DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Brand-name Latanoprost One Its Generic Version Primary Open Angle Glaucoma Ocular Hypertension
DOC.criteria: 1 . > 18 year old 2 . Primary open angle glaucoma , glaucoma suspect ocular hypertension 3 . Bilateral 4 . Without treatment treat latanoprost another prostaglandin analog 5 . Intraocular pressure > 21mmHg ( without treatment washout period ) 1 . Intraocular pressure > 30mmHg 2 . Secondary glaucoma ( uveitic , neovascular , traumatic ) congenital glaucoma 3 . Pseudoexfoliation syndrome 4 . Pigmentary dispersion syndrome Pigmentary glaucoma 5 . Severe glaucoma ; Cuptodisc ratio ≥9/10 OU Loss central visual field ( central 10° ) 6 . Use topical medication lower intraocular pressure 7 . Pregnancy breastfeed 8 . Being allergic latanoprost benzalkonium chloride ( BAK ) 9 . Current use acetazolamide ( Diamox ) 10 . Changes systemic dos betablockers study 11 . Recent use topical corticosteroid ( < 1 month ) 12 . Contact lens wearer 13 . Closed angle gonioscopy past angle closure glaucoma 14 . Filtration surgery ( example . : trabeculectomy ) 15 . Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty ( SLT ) Argon Laser Trabeculoplasty ( ALT ) 16 . Recent Intraocular surgery ( < 3 month ) 17 . Refractive surgery 18 . Recent iridotomy capsulotomy ( < 3 month ) 19 . Past medical history ocular trauma ( example : angle recession ) 20 . Past active uveitis 21 . Herpetic keratitis 22 . Monocular vision
